reviewText: Ice Cube is portrayed as some type of major badass in the movie, but you never can tell why. He's mostly just angry and scowls a lot. Other guy is just marginally funny, and never shuts up. Abundance of d*ck jokes. Actually regretted selecting this about 15 minutes in.
summary: Watch if you've watched everything else. If it's sunny, go outside instead.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: There are plenty of hilarious moments in Ride Along, most of them involving Kevin Hart's antics to try to gain respect from his girlfriend's brother and everyone around him. Parents should know that the PG-13 rating is really stretching it here, as there's lots of innuendo (specifically at the beginning when the main character and his girlfriend talk explicitly about their "night plans") and gun violence. Some of it is good-natured, and some of it isn't. Fortunately, the tone of the movie is consistently playful and entertaining throughout, and it avoids boring stretches of time or weird shifts in theme. That definitely makes a type of movie like Ride Along recommendable for anyone wanting to see an hour-and-a-half worth of well-paced comedy.It's not at all original, a criticism that has been the main reason for the film's low rating on popular sites like Rotten Tomatoes and IMDB. Most of the twists and surprises don't make the film any different from other buddy cop movies. The plot almost feels like a pit stop between moments where Kevin Hart isn't showcasing his humor. And with the slight exception of Hart, most of the acting is quite generic, like the plot itself. In particular is Ice Cube, who's really just in the movie to play the non-comedic foil.The good news is that the screenwriters didn't dwell too much on trying to sell you on those aspects. Instead it's more focused on trying to make you laugh, something that this movie does well. Because of the great timing and spacing of the many jokes in the film, the shortcomings won't prevent you from enjoying Ride Along. Viewers should go in expecting a genuinely funny movie, because that's all this type of film really needs anyway.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: So this is a remake of the Sandra Bullock movie with Melissa McCarthy called The Heat. In addition, it’s a remake of the Bruce Willis/Tracy Morgan film called Cop Out. Oh, and it’s a remake of the Marky Mark movie with Will Ferrell. Ok…so you are seeing a trend here with a good cop slash lazy-loose cop film. This film is not breaking new ground and I feel it will only appeal to diehard Kevin Hart fans. I am a fan of good comedy, but this film was downright painful to watch in the movie theater. It truly was. I looked at my watch so many times to see when this thing would end. Kevin is straight up annoying and the sound of his nasal voice drives me up a wall. Certain comedian’s talents just don’t translate well on screen. This is a perfect example of one of them. Stir clear of this film.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: I bought the movie mostly because my son is an avid fan of Kevin Hart and I am a fan of Ice Cube. One would think that together they would make a good buddy movie. Sorry, there was no real chemistry between them. The moments that Kevin Hart had were sometimes funny, sometimes strained. Ice Cube was a great straight man but he is a proven actor in both comedy, drama's and Sci-Fi.The entire premise was that Kevin Hart is engaged to Ice Cube's sister and she wants them both to get along, it's important to her that her big  brother approve. Okay, a storyline that has proven to be hit and miss before and this time it's a miss. Like I said, there is no chemistry between the two men that could have made this into a great comedy. Is Kevin Hart funny, yes he is and he does have a few scenes where he is hilarious but not enough to save the movie. It's good to pass a couple of hours but Ice Cube's talent is wasted here.
Title: Ride Along

Title: Ride Along

reviewText: The beginning months of the year are never the greatest time for comedic films, but you certainly can't go wrong when Kevin Hart is your lead actor. He's quickly rising to the top, starring in popular movies like "Think Like a Man" and "The Five-Year Engagement" in the past few years. Though his new movie "Ride Along" never surpasses some of his more funnier work, that isn't to say it's not good. It had me laughing throughout, and I'm betting it will do the same to you.The story centers around Ben (Kevin Hart), a fast talking security guard who wants to marry his long-time girlfriend Angela. The only thing standing in his way is her brother James, played by Ice Cube, a decorated police officer who isn't exactly fond of him. In order to prove he's worthy, Ben is forced to go on a ride along and is quickly wrapped up into the scary crime-scene of Atlanta. As you can imagine, the hilarity ensues.This definitely isn't a movie to take too seriously, just sit back and enjoy it. Hart easily carries the film and provides most, if not all, of the laughs. It may not be the greatest comedy out there, but it would make a killer Friday-night rental. Rated PG-13 for violence and language, "Ride Along" is fun and entertaining.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: I enjoyed Ride Along. Ice Cube was good as the tough guy. Kevin Hart was funny as Cubes potential brother in law. The laughs and action breezed along at a fast pace. Tika Sumpter was fine as Harts love interest. I just wish that she would stop wearing unflattering wigs in her movies (Sparkle, A Madea's Christmas), they look terrible. Cube should've made sure that the soundtrack was hot and incorporated more hit songs into the soundtrack. The music was ok. Larry Fishburne was great in his role. Everyone in this film delivered. Tim Story should make a sequel. Highly recommended for fans of action comedies!

Title: Ride Along

reviewText: From the trailers, this movie seemed as if it was going to be the best comedy of the year. Kevin Hart is one of my all time favorite comedians and his stand up always has me laughing to the point of tears. I thought this movie was going to be the same...THOUGHT being key word.I'm not usually one for action movies, much less buddy-cop films, but last year I saw The Heat and thought it was downright hilarious. And I will say that 21 Jump Street with Channing Tatum and Jonah Hill is one of my all time favorite movies, but I think that's because the comedy easily outweighs the action in those two films. I can't say the same for Ride Along.This movie had way more action than the trailer let on, and it was basically just another shoot-em-up flick with some humor here and there for me. Ice Cube and Kevin Hart are a great comedic duo, but I felt like the script could have been a lot funnier, especially with someone like Kevin Hart being the lead role.So overall if you're really into generic, buddy-cop action movies, this is the right film for you! Just don't expect to be in stitches while watching!
summary: Not At All What I Expected
Title: Ride Along

reviewerName: Chief Rocka Dr. Kool "Chief Rocka Dr. Kool"
reviewText: Before I even started, I knew this was not going to be good because Kevin Hart is the most unfunny so-called comedian I have ever witnessed!  Ellen is funnier than he is and she/he is not even funny!  Man, this was horrible!Ice Cube is the only thing good about this film, but even his acting was sub par.  This was clearly a cheap production and a pay grab for the known actors in the film.  The directing was horrible with poor timing and hardly any musical accompaniment.  Kevin Hart was his typical loud, rude and annoying self - ZERO funny jokes!  They tried to make this Hart's Eddie Murphy "48 Hours" moment,  but Hart is not funny and he does not have the charisma to pull anything off.  All he does is talk loud, act stupid and makes Amos N Andy type faces.It is sad that they are working on another as we speak, and by the time I am done writing this review, it should be finished!  That is about as much time as they took to make this garbage.  I would bet that box office receipts were forged in order to help Kevin Hart's deal with the devil for his fame, because word of mouth alone should have buried this film!  It is not that I am a Hart hater - I give everyone a chance, but this guy does not have IT, he had to have it given to him, and it shows from his uninteresting and unfunny performances.If you must see this just to see it, then do it.  However, I would never buy this and it is hard to watch one time, let alone twice.  Hollywood, do us all a favor and retire Kevin Hart.  I cannot believe how unfunny so-called comedians are.  I know I can do a much better job improvising while filming a movie.
summary: Kevin Hart is TOTALLY Not Funny!!!  He got the hook up on FAME!

Title: Ride Along

reviewText: Ride Along is a comedy which stars Ice Cube, Kevin Hart, John Leguizamo, Bryan Callen, Tika Sumpter and Laurence Fishburne.  The film was directed by Tim Story (Think Like a Man) and written by Greg Coolidge, Jason Mantzoukas (The League), Phil Hay, and Matt Manfredi.  The story is pretty simple; it follows a security guard Ben (Kevin Hart) who must prove himself to his girlfriend's brother, top cop James (Ice Cube).  Ben rides along with James on a 24-hour patrol of Atlanta.I found this film very funny and when Kevin Hart was allowed within the script there were some pretty heartfelt moments.  I enjoyed this movie and would definitely recommend it to others.Thank you for reading my review.
summary: Ice Cube and Kevin Hart make a very funny duo
Title: Ride Along

Title: Ride Along

reviewText: Ben is a security guard at an Atlanta high school, who's just been accepted to the police academy.  The only catch?  His girlfriend's dominating, intimidating super-cop brother, James.  In an effort to discourage Ben, James decides to take his would-be brother-in-law on a ride along, all while tracking down mysterious criminal kingpin Omar.I don't like a lot of his films, but I'm a pretty big Kevin Hart fan; he's got comedic timing that you rarely see these days.  And there's no denying that no one does tough like Ice Cube.  The two have pretty good chemistry, too, and their scenes together are among RIDE ALONG's best.  Also along is a surprisingly strong supporting cast: John Leguizamo, Bruce McGill, Bryan Callen, and especially Laurence Fishburne.  Unfortunately, they are hindered by a so-so script that goes from super-budget action (in the first five minutes, Ice Cube drives a souped up pickup through an explosion, and while it's a draw-dropping effect, our disbelief can only be suspended too far), to rom-com, to bromance, to...well, you get the idea.  RIDE ALONG doesn't quite know what it wants to be.  The best scenes have a feel of improvisation (you can see Ice Cube on the verge of laughter multiple times), where the story takes a backseat to the actors' chemistry.  This film is good for killing a couple of hours, but I won't go to great effort to see it again.  Give it a shot if you'd like a few chuckles, but there are better buddy-cop comedies out there.
summary: Some good moments, and a nice cast, but ultimately disappointing.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: This is the second worse movie I’ve seen so far this year. It would’ve been the worse, but I expected more from I, Frankenstein and that was just so disappointing that I have that one as the worst movie so far this year. I would not have watched Ride Along voluntarily but a friend rented it and I was in the wrong place at the wrong time. I hate it when they get an actor, like Kevin Hart, who is kind of the flavor of the month and put them into a vehicle movie that was thrown together hap-hazardly. As my friend would say, “You gotta be a fan”. I like Kevin hart, but I wouldn’t say I’m a huge fan, certainly not big enough to enjoy this movie. Kevin Hart wants to marry Ice Cube’s sister. Ice Cube doesn’t like him. Kevin Hart wants Ice Cube’s approval. Ice Cube is cop, so he takes Hart on a ride along with him to work. Of course Cube is trying to discourage Hart, so he will stay away from Cube’s sister, but Hart is a resilient all be it pretty stupid guy. Completely implausible plot, but that’s not really the complaint I have. It’s just not funny. I don’t think I laughed once. The jokes are so old and over-used. They should’ve gotten better writers to write a funnier script.
summary: This is the second worse movie I’ve seen so far this year
Title: Ride Along

And comedy is one of my favorite things in the world. Also the gag reel left me wondering when the funny part was coming and it never did.

reviewText: Here were are, yet again with another team-up cop movie – as if we haven’t seen enough of those over the years.  Most recently, Sandra Bullock and Melissa McCarthy starred together in The Heat, but prior to that we’ve seen an endless array of partnerships over the years, just a few of which include Will Smith and Tommy Lee Jones in Men in Black, Jackie Chan and Chris Tucker in Rush Hour, and if you really want to dig deep, then there’s Jim Belushi and man’s best friend in K-9.  The list of duos is endless and we could sit here all day running down the partnerships, but the bottom line here is that this style of storytelling is so unbelievably tiresome that it needs to stop.  And, if you require proof, just watch the “comedy,” Ride Along.Director Tim Story (Think Like a Man, Barbershop) re-teams with both Ice Cube and Kevin Hart in Ride Along.  Ice Cube stars as James Payton, an Atlanta police officer that has been working on a dead-end case, chasing after a “ghost” arms dealer, known only as Omar.  At the same time, his sister, Angela (Tika Sumpter), has been dating a school security guard and video game addict, Ben (Kevin Hart).  The two are preparing to share the news with James they want to get married.Ben, like James, has ambitions to be a police officer and applies to the academy, of which he is accepted.  Excited by the acceptance, Ben shares the news with James about the academy and also seeks his approval to marry his sister.  James is immediately dismissive, finding Ben to be horribly irritating, not to mention disapproving of him even dating his sister, let alone marrying her.  Hoping to deter Ben from joining the academy, James decides to take him on a ride along, telling him if he is able to successfully make it through the day, he will give him his blessing – all the while James knowingly takes on all of the police department’s most ridiculous calls.For reasons beyond comprehension, some people seem to be under the impression that Kevin Hart is revitalizing his career by taking on roles of this nature.  If you know anything about Hart or have possibly even seen his act, then you know he’s easily comparable to someone like Chris Tucker – meaning a character actor that seemingly never stops talking.  Unfortunately, has to make a comment about anything and everything, and it gets to point in this film where it’s nearly unbearable.  He’s tries too hard to be funny and in doing so, comes off as insincere and downright stale.  After taking roles in recent films, like Grudge Match, Think Like a Man, and now Ride Along – he’s not helping his case to be recognized as a legitimate, reputable actor.Ice Cube, like Kevin Hart, is also is also a repeat offender when it comes to playing the same role over and over again.  Hart creates brief moments of laughter, but it’s only due to Ice Cube’s serious demeanor.  Cube has a miniscule amount of leading role potential, but he wasted it on sorry films like All About the Benjamins and the Friday sequels.  Still, he has proven to at least be occasionally entertaining, mostly in TV commercials or his role in 21 Jump Street.  He might be the lead in this film, but the plot tries to cater more towards Hart’s petty excuse for humor – which is vulgar, sexual, and insulting.  Apparently, that can all pass with a PG-13 rating these days.The majority of the film’s scenes are just one ridiculous encounter after another – evident in the moments where Hart’s character attempts to sway a group of bikers to move from a handicapped parking spot or in another scene where it’s supposed to be funny that a random guy is throwing food in a supermarket.  Is this really what passes for entertainment?  Surely there’s better things to spend your money on than watching someone refer to his nether region as “Black Hammer” or fight with someone in a cop car over who gets to say “roger that.”If there’s one actor I really feel bad for, it’s Lawrence Fishburne.  There’s really nothing more irritating than to see a talented actor lending his time to a horrendous film.  To make matters worse, Ride Along tries to make it seem like a big shocker that Fishburne shows up towards the end as the villain.  He was prominently advertised in the opening credits, which makes it painfully obvious he was going to be the villain.  And, when he finally does show up – it leads to a completely predictable and uneventful showdown.Overall, Ride Along is about as entertaining as the commercial advertisements make it out to be.  There are brief moments of laughter, but nothing that you’ll point to and say that was the funniest moment in the film.  The puns are repetitive and childish, while the acting is mediocre and tedious.  Kevin Hart continues the trend of making himself a part of dull-witted films, while Ice Cube continues his trend of portraying hard-nosed characters.  Already, word has spread that Ride Along will receive the sequel treatment – after shocking the box office by earning a hefty payday.  However, if you plan to shell out cash to watch such a ridiculous movie, don’t be surprised when you feel foolish for doing so after it’s over.GRADE:  DFNDNreview.com
summary: Ice Cube & Kevin Hart star in generic, cheesy cop comedy
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: The writers need to get out of Hollywood and get a real life.Beginning scene of black high school athlete following some loser white dude into something dumb is about as likely as flying pigs. Opening scenes with car chases weaving through pedestrian traffic with 180 degree spins accompanied with guns-a-blazing & leaping acrobatics is so tiresomely old that a good nap was in order during it all. Made worse by being overly fakey. Then add an even more tiresome cliché of a run in with stereotyped bikers. A lot of Tyler Perry style black face "lack of humor" that does more harm than help in destroying stereotypes. Usual Eastern European bad guys selling stuff from a dockside warehouse (where it all eventually ends in shootout - of course). Predictable cop and wannabe cop get it together.The whole movie was as imaginative as a cheap, without anything, burger.

reviewText: I used to like Kevin Hart and then I started to watch a few of his movies. After about three or four movies you realize, every one of his jokes are the same. Once you realize that you're hearing the same punchline again and again, he simply has no value left. This movie was the point when I realized that Kevin Hart really offers nothing new or creative which is sad because this movie had potential. In the end though, buying this to watch was a waste of time and money. Save time and watch the trailer on youtube for free. After the trailer, there is nothing more to this movie.
summary: It's time for someone to tell Kevin Hart that he isn't very funny
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: Director Tim Story ("Think Like a Man") brings us a crowd pleaser that had the screening audience laughing from the first frame. Of course that is partly due to the great popularity of fast-talking Kevin Hart, but this silly odd-couple story is fun. Any self-respecting police department would NEVER allow the sorts of capers we see, but what's a few plot holes between friends? It certainly didn't handicap writers Greg Coolidge ("Baby Mama") and Jason Mantzoukas (Lots of TV) as they pile laugh upon laugh while we happily suspend disbelief and wait for the happy ending.Even through our hero is steadily employed as a security guard, he really, REALLY wants to be an Atlanta police officer like his finance's brother James. He feels prepared: after all, he has played a cop in countless video games. There are three important things in his life: Being a cop, those video games and his gorgeous fiancée Angela.We watch:* Kevin Hart ("Grudge Match") is our hero Ben, who has finagled a ride in a cop car with his potential brother-in-law to prove he is worthy to marry into the family. (Every legitimate PD in the country is shaking its collective head.)* Tika Sumpter ("Tyler Perry's A Madea Christmas") plays our hero's lovely sweetheart, Angela. This patient gal seems to find his immature ADHD-type personality appealing.* Ice Cube ("21 Jump Street") brings us James, a no-nonsense cop who has trust issues, particularly with this haywire fruitcake his sister Angela has unaccountably fallen for.* Bruce McGill ("Lincoln") will always convince ME that he is a tough but fair police captain who is running out of patience: Detective James is highly effective, but his unorthodox methods are difficult to justify.Of course we have other cops who provide backup, plus a surprise mystery guest whom I won't divulge because he is uncredited, so that would be a spoiler.This is PG-13, so expect mild profanity, no nudity, no sweaty bodies, some vehicular mayhem, some dandy blowie uppie stuff and a LOT of gunfire! By the time Ben gets his hands on a loaded gun, I was ready to slap him! I've been around guns all my life and have never see such careless mishandling! I know, I know, it's a comedy, but....Amazon will notify me when the DVD is available so I can broadcast a notice for my JayFlix.net folks.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: This movie has the same old theme:  A cop's sister has a silly boyfriend who wants to be a grown-up cop, so he takes him on a unofficial "ride along," where all sorts of predictable happenings occur.  What follows?  Use your imagination.  It won't take much. I am tired of black producers (and white producers) making "junk movies" for black audiences.  Yes, this is mainly a movie  made for black audiences.  White audiences only go see black movies if "popular, white actors" are in them.  Ice Cube, and other black directors and producers are now taking "white theme" movies and placing black actors in them...the result is pure "boredom."  I miss the old days of "Car Wash," and "Shaft..." while those movies perpetrated the "black pimp" stereotype, they were entertaining and very funny.  Kevin Hart, can be funny (he is a stand-up comic), but I did not find him very funny in this movie...perhaps it was the bad script.  He was much funnier in the movie, "About Last Night."  My advice to him is for him to attempt other types of ventures...other than comedies, to avoid becoming typecast as a "self-deprecating" comic.  The movie grossed over one-hundred million, so we know there WILL be a re-make.  Oh, well...its all about money these days.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: Awful. One of the worst movies I've suffered half way through in a long time. Predictable and very badly acted. Huge waste of money and time.

The story was decent, but this is a movie you will rent, watch, and never really think about again.

reviewText: The best part of this movie was when it ended. It's simply not funny. Ice Cube plays his usual role, angry and serious. Kevin Hart plays a short Chris Tucker wannabe, but a lot less funny. The story seemed secondary to forced g-rated "training day" references. The movie just isn't funny, nor is it heart warming. It's borderline slapstick as Hart illegally shoots suspects and informants while Cube makes angry comments. This movie is a waste of time.

reviewText: In Ride Along, Ben (Kevin Hart) tries to prove himself worthy of marrying detective James' (Ice Cube) sister on a ride-along through Atlanta's streets.Kevin Hart's antics always make me laugh and he is his same fast talking silly self in this movie as well and with Ice Cube playing the straight man, the combination has moments that are funny.  The problem though as the funny moments seem to get less and less as the movie goes along, almost as if the movie starts taking itself a bit too seriously.  The action scenes are done well enough but almost seem out of place in a movie that is advertised as a comedy.This movie is ok to watch but the funny moments dwindle as the movie goes along and could have been better.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: Angela (Tika Sumpter) wants to marry Ben (Kevin Hart), but her brother, James (Ice Cube), is against it. James is a police officer. To prove himself worthy of James' sister, Ben agrees to go on a ride along.I watched this movie months ago when it was in theaters. Ride Along has a lot of crude humor I did not care for, but there are parts that gave me a good belly laugh. Kevin Hart makes common sense funny.

reviewText: Ice Cube is cool as detective James Payton, but it’s pseudo partner Ben Barber, played by Kevin Hart, who steals the show. He’s funnier here as an actor than he is as a stand-up (on-stage) comedian; so in a movie with such a hackneyed plot, the jokes are the driving force. This is essentially a loose parody of Training Day, a fact the script is just clever enough to acknowledge.marcellee.com
Title: Ride Along

reviewerName: Mark Eremite "This Is A Display Model Only"
reviewText: Let's say your dad owns a movie studio. You're content to lie around all day, living the high life off of his dime. But he's annoyed with your slacker ways. In an attempt to get you to actually do something with your life -- anything! -- he tosses $25,000,000 dollars in your lap and orders you to make a movie."But Daaaad," you whine. "I don't wanna!""No son of mine is going to waste his life playing video games and smoking those herbal jazz cigarettes and getting fat on Moon Pies!" he barks. "Make a movie!""But Daaaad," you whine. "I don't even have a story!""Make a buddy-cop action flick," he demands. "Those are easy. One of the cops will be tough and no-nonsense. The other one will be a goofy, bumbling idiot who's over his head. Through various hi-jinks, they'll learn to respect each other. Also, there should be some kind of serious plot that leads to a big, explosive climax. Make it about drugs. No, wait. Drugs are played out. Guns. Make it about guns. The bad guys should be some kind of race that you won't get into trouble for stereotyping. Croatian. No, wait. Our maid is Croatian. I've got it! Serbian. Serbian bad guys with guns.""But I don't know what I'm doing," you whine."Don't worry about it," your dad waves. "Also, I'll get Laurence Fishburne to be in it. He owes me a big favor.""Really? Why?"Your dad smiles knowingly. "HE knows why."So, to prepare, you sit down with some herbal jazz cigarettes and  watch every buddy-cop film you can find, occasionally remembering to take notes on the plot elements that pop up most frequently. Then, surly and unmotivated, you write your movie. The script turns out to be twelve pages long, and most of that is about first-person shooter games."Daaaaad," you whine. "Writing a movie is hard! My script is too  short!""Don't worry about it," your dad says. "Get a popular comedian in one of the lead roles and just let him ad-lib and mug and riff all over the place. Make sure a camera is running on him at all times. Let him do whatever he wants. Also, give him a girlfriend who is impossibly good-looking and who runs around half-naked for most of the film. Are you writing this down?"So, finally, you make your film. You put some of your favorite songs in it, even though they don't really match the action or story. You edit it while smoking herbal jazz cigarettes, so sequences and plotlines don't totally line up right. Laurence Fishburne is so disgusted with you that he phones in almost his entire performance along with pretty much everyone else except for your comedic lead, who throws himself into the role like a coke-era Robin Williams. Behind your back, people grumble about what a schlocky, sloppy, uninspired mess the film is, the only decent aspect of it being -- ironically -- the inside jokes related to video games. But you finally finish it."Can I go now?" you grumble to your dad."Yes, son," he says. "I'm proud of you son.""Proud?" you sneer. "I barely even tried.""I know," he grins lovingly. "And you just made us over one hundred million dollars.""Wow," you say. "That's amazing!"Your dad blinks away the dollar signs in his eyes and says, "If you ever get the urge, do you have a sequel in you?"You can see it now! Ride Along 2: Ride Alonger!
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: The set up for this buddy-cop comedy was excellent, but despite a few funny or clever moments, the film was mostly a loudfrenetic series of shoot-outs, car chases, explosions, and yelling.  lce Cube plays a seasoned cop who takes Kevin Hart on aride along, to see if he is worthy of marrying Cube's sister.  Of course, he messes up most of his opportunities, and ultimatelycomes through.  That was a given.  It was the situations and character development that were lacking, mostly due to a verypedestrian script.  I just saw "Bad Grandpa" two days prior to this, and it was 1000% funnier.
summary: Not Nearly As Funny As I Expected

reviewText: This movie was much better that I was expecting. It had some great one-liners and is the 1st best comedy of the year. Ice Cube and Kevin Hart were perfectly matched and played to each other's comedy style very well. Hart plays Ben Barber, a jumpy security guard who plays video games and in love with James's sister, Angela. James hates Ben and wants nothing to do with him. When Ben is accepted at the police academy, James decides to take him on a 'ride along' to show him what the police world is really like. Throughout the day, James gives Ben silly assignments that no one else wants. It all leads up to a confrontation with Omar, the main villain that James is obsessed with catching. If you want a good comedy, I highly recommend RIDE ALONG!!!

reviewText: **1/2“Ride Along” isn’t technically a “cop buddy” comedy - seeing as one of the characters isn’t actually a cop - though the movie follows the basic formula almost to a tee.Ice Cube plays James Payton, an Atlanta police officer who doesn’t much care for the man his sister (Ika Sumpter) is currently dating, one Ben Barger (Kevin Hart), a ne’er-do-well goofball who works as a security guard at a high school when he isn’t sitting at home on the couch playing video games. Ben does, however, suffer from delusions of grandeur when it comes to what he plans to do with his life, which is to use his skills as a gamer to become one hell of a real life crime fighter. James agrees to take Ben on a “ride along” in his squad car to see if he has what it takes to be a cop. Hilarity ensues.Or at least it would if the one-joke premise didn’t run out of steam about a half hour into the movie’s running time. Actually, “Ride Along” starts off on a promising note, with breezy, fast-paced dialogue and a genuine rapport established between Hart as the comic cutup and Ice Cube as his requisite straight man (think of them as an African-American version of Martin and Lewis).But the concept begins to pall early on, as too many of the scenes run on well past their sell-by dates as far as generating any further laughs is concerned. A pity, in that, given better material, Hart, especially, might have made something decent out of “Ride Along.”
summary: Actors done in by a weak script

reviewText: I enjoyed this movie. It's what you'd expect it to be...it's a comedy and good for a few laughs. It's perfect for when you're in the mood to be entertained. If you're looking for a deep, complex plot and lots of character development, you might want to pick something else.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: This movie is very funny! I was very entertained by Kevin Hart and Ice Cube. I feel the jokes were very good. Yes, this is a typical slap-stick movie and that's what I wanted to see. Please don't expect an award winning movie - and that is nominated for this and that - it's not that at all. It just a funny movie that you can just sit down for a hour and half, and laugh at what you're seeing.Also, don't expect to see something new and ah looking: nope. It's more like seeing something done before, and expecting to see something done stupidly by Hart. Ice Cube plays his character very well to me. He plays a cop that has been through a lot of stuff and is a no mess around guy, which Hart's character is a total opposite of because he just got into the police academy. Yes, this kind of duo has been done before, so if you thought you're going to see something else, don't watch it then. I love seeing this kind of team up and that's why I watched it.The only thing I didn't like watch that it was kind of short for me. I wanted to see more of it and more funny scenes. They didn't set up the movie do a sequel ending scene so that's good. If there is one though, I probably would go watch it.
Title: Ride Along

reviewerName: The Movie Guy "Movies from A to Z"
reviewText: Ben "The Black Hammer" Barber (Kevin Hart) is living with Angela (Tika Sumpter) the sister of super cop James Payton (Ice Cube). Ben works as a school security guard and aspires to be a policeman like James. Ben plays video games and is not highly thought of by James. When Ben asks James permission to marry his sister, James wants Ben to prove himself by going on a "ride along." While James puts Ben through the comedy ringer, he is looking for the elusive Omar (Laurence Fishburne), a major crime boss in the city.The plot was fairly simple and didn't develop the complexity or irony I was hoping for, i.e. Omar being part of Ben's on-line gamers. The comedy was akin to skit comedy with scenes being almost unrelated and the comedy of one scene not building on another. Of course one shouldn't expect too much from the guy who brought us "Employee of the Month."The movie is a good popcorn film good for a few laughs.Parental Guide: 1 quick f-bomb. No sex or nudity. Sex talk.
summary: I'M CRAZY, BUT IN A GOOD WAY,
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: sort of draggged.... story line is boring and their back to back banter has been seen before. I like them both, but this movie seems to have been done in a rush to profit from Hart's increased popularity.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: "Maybe this guys alright, he just wants into the family." Ben Barber (Hart) is a security guard with aspirations of becoming a real cop. His girlfriends brother James Payton (Cube) is a real cop but isn't impressed with Ben and thinks she can do better. When she convinces James to take Ben out on a ride along with him to get to know him better Ben is excited, James has other ideas though. What starts off as a way for James to get rid of Ben turns serious when real trouble finds them. I am a fan of the buddy cop genre but really since Lethal weapon it seems that every movie like that tries to copy it. This one is a little different, it tries to copy every buddy cop movie ever. I did think the movie was funny in some parts and I am glad I watched it but it was overly generic to the point of almost being a spoof. I think the big problem I had with this is that it tried way to hard to be funny and some of the comedy came off as being forced. Kevin Hart is a funny guy but he seemed to be trying to hard in this movie. There was really no chemistry between the two and that hurt the movie and the comedy. Overall, funny in parts but tried to hard to get laughs and the movie felt very forced. I give this a B-.
summary: There was really no chemistry between the two and that hurt the movie and the comedy. It came off feeling very forced.

reviewText: First of all I will say that I laughed at most of the jokes in this movie, but (to me) ICE CUBE is one of those actors that can be over the top and really starts to annoy me.And to answer those who say, "that is who he is".  I understand that his persona is a "Tough Guy", but lets all be realistic... Would you spend all day watching that and not get annoyed at some point?Anyway on to more review... I really think Kevin Hart can be funny, but I guess I would have toned down the bravado of I'm gonna prove I am a "Tough Guy" under tone of the movie as it started to make the show very unrealistic to me.So in the end, I give it only two stars.  I walked away from this with the opinion that I would rather watch another 'Rush Hour' movie than this one at all.
summary: Watchable, partly funny, but maybe too over the top

reviewText: The potential is there for Ice Cube to become a superb actor. This particular dialog in the play just didn't seem t fit him. It didn't seem to me that he was comfortable with the role he was playing. I would like to see him in a role in which he was comfortable then his acting would appear more natural. I would tell him not to stray out side of his comfort zone when accepting roles. Try not to get type casted by the public. You have what it takes to be as great an actor as Denzel Washington but to drop his name in the movie seemed out of place to me.
summary: I tried to follow this movie.and I gave this thoughfull consideration but the actors just needed to be a little more seasoned.

reviewerName: Whipple McTeelson the Third "Purveryor of Mad...
reviewText: If this is the best way you can find to spend two hours then may I suggest that you go down to your local store and pick 'a life' off the rack and take it over to the customer service dept and put it on layaway.Half the time I sat through this thing at the local dollar theater I kept getting distracted by a huge piece of wallpaper that was peeling off.  Sure, the movie was nowhere near the price of admission excluding the $2.50 I spent on the greasy popcorn and the 75cents for the flat soda pop I snuck in my coat pocket.  But watching that wallpaper hanging tenderly yet so fragilely off the theater wall inching it's way downward was the most suspense that kept me on the edge of my seat in years watching movies at this joint.
summary: If this is the best way you can find to spend two hours then may I suggest...

reviewText: Kevin Hart needs some Help , he was so crazy in this story  I don't know how they were able to keep a straight face.
Title: Ride Along

reviewText: Wow, what a disappointing comedy.  Ice Cube pretending to be tough.  Kevin Hart pretending to be soft.  Using bland humor and cutesy buddy comedy twists and hoping we giggle like schoolgirls.The plot is easy to figure out, with a lot of attempts at being funny that totally fail.  If you laugh at all, it is because of Kevin Hart.  And the laughs don't come that often.  He is underused, which stinks.  Then you have Leguizamo who is in the film as a manikin, basically.  He is woefully underused as well.There is an entertaining action sequence in the end, but everything up until then is just bland.  You can see there were quite a few scenes where Hart could have shined, but the film makers chose to accept the boring cut and move on.  Lazy production.NEVER BUY THIS.  You might want to finish it, but you will never watch it twice.  You are much better off renting Kevin Hart's stand-up specials.  If you want to see Ice Cube in a much tougher role, rent Ghosts of Mars.  He co-stars with Jason Statham before he was famous.
Title: Ride Along
